data.title: Industry leading content and networking
data.meta_description: The 22nd annual Private Funds CFO Network New York Forum is the industry benchmark for high-value content and networking.
data.text:
We are a professional membership offering exclusive access to a trusted community of private equity CFOs, CCOs and COOs, a wide range of resources, thought leadership and more. The Network provides members with essential information on market trends, compliance topics, regulatory insights, useful tools, online and in-person events and a comprehensive resource library. Members have access to behind-the-scenes, closed-door conversations among a community of peers who share their knowledge and expertise within our trusted Network.

e are a professional membership offering exclusive access to investors, a wide range of resources, thought leadership and more. The Network provides members with essential information on market trends, compliance topics, regulatory insights, useful tools, online and in-person events and a comprehensive resource library. Members have access to behind-the-scenes, closed-door conversations among a community of peers who share their knowledge and expertise within our trusted Network.

We are a professional membership offering exclusive access to a trusted community of private equity CFOs, CCOs and COOs, a wide range of resources, thought leadership and more. The Network provides members with essential information on market trends, compliance topics, regulatory insights, useful tools, online and in-person events and a comprehensive resource library. Members have access to behind-the-scenes, closed-door conversations among a community of peers who share their knowledge and expertise within our trusted Network.

e are a professional membership offering exclusive access to investors, a wide range of resources, thought leadership and more. The Network provides members with essential information on market trends, compliance topics, regulatory insights, useful tools, online and in-person events and a comprehensive resource library. Members have access to behind-the-scenes, closed-door conversations among a community of peers who share their knowledge and expertise within our trusted Network.

Joann Barsky is the Head of Finance and Operations at Town Hall Ventures, a healthcare focused venture capital firm. Ms. Barsky oversees the financial reporting of the firm and its investment funds, and is responsible for the day-to-day management of firm-wide operations, tax, human resources, and IT. In addition, she supports the firm’s regulatory compliance program and works closely on legal matters and investor relations. Previously, Ms. Barsky was the Controller for Angelo Gordon’s private equity funds, which focus on middle market transactions in the financial services, consumer, and healthcare industries. Prior to Angelo Gordon, she worked in Deloitte & Touche’s Audit and Assurance Group. Ms. Barsky graduated from Boston University with a double concentration in Accounting and Finance.

Founded in 2018, Town Hall Ventures is a venture capital investment firm based in New York, New York. We seek to partner with entrepreneurs who are as passionate as we are about changing our health care system. We were early backers of companies like Cityblock, VillageMD, Unite Us, Habitat Health, and many others, and like to focus our energy working side-by-side with our entrepreneurs to scale breakthrough companies that will transform US healthcare.

Michael S. Chae is the Chief Financial Officer of Blackstone. He is a member of the firm’s Management Committee and investment committees across most of the firm’s businesses. Since joining Blackstone in 1997, Mr. Chae has served in a broad range of leadership roles including Head of International Private Equity, Head of Private Equity for Asia Pacific, and as a senior partner in the U.S. Private Equity business, where he led numerous Blackstone investments and served on the boards of many private and publicly traded portfolio companies.

Mr. Chae received an AB from Harvard College, an MPhil. in International Relations from Cambridge University, and a JD from Yale Law School. Mr. Chae serves on the boards of the Harvard Management Company, Robin Hood Foundation, St. Bernard’s School, and the Asia Society. He is a Trustee Emeritus and the former Board President of the Lawrenceville School. He is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, and founded the Chae Initiative in Private Sector Leadership at Yale Law School.

Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to deliver compelling returns for institutional and individual investors by strengthening the companies in which we invest. Our more than $1 trillion in assets under management include global investment strategies focused on real estate, private equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, credit, real assets, secondaries and hedge funds. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, X (Twitter), and Instagram.

Norm Champ is a partner in the New York office of Kirkland & Ellis LLP, where he heads up the regulatory solutions practice in the Investment Funds Group. Previously, Norm was the director of the Division of Investment Management at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Prior to that he was the Deputy Director of the SEC’s Office of Compliance, Inspections and Examinations (OCIE) and the Associate Regional Director for Examinations in the SEC’s New York Regional Office. In these capacities he supervised SEC examinations of investment advisers and other market participants.

Norm counsels the most sophisticated private fund sponsors in the world on complying with the constantly changing regulatory environment in the United States and other countries. Private fund sponsors seek out Norm’s advice because he can bring to bear his perspective as a former regulator, a former partner of a private fund manager and now a law firm partner. Norm’s large and wide-ranging practice, including defending numerous SEC examinations, gives him unparalleled insight into the most pressing regulatory issues in the market.

Norm advises private fund sponsors in five main areas:

• Adviser Structuring — Counseling new sponsors and existing sponsors in structuring and registering investment advisers, including setting up compliance infrastructure.

• Fundraising — Assisting private fund sponsors in fundraising to make sure disclosure meets regulators’ expectations.

• Transactions — Private fund sponsors often consult Norm on deals to make sure that deal structures and related fees will withstand regulatory scrutiny.

• GP Strategic Matters — Assisting private fund sponsors with regulatory issues regarding minority stake sales, asset management mergers and acquisitions and secondary transactions.

• Government Interaction — Kirkland has represented private fund sponsors in numerous examinations and enforcement actions, including more than 175 SEC examinations since 2012. Norm and his team draw on this vast store of knowledge to help private fund sponsors avoid issues and navigate SEC examinations and investigations.

Norm’s most recent book, Mastering Money, a personal finance guide for all working Americans, is available on Amazon, www.Barnesandnoble.com and in stores. Norm has appeared on Fox Business News, CNBC, Newsmax, WABC Radio, Fox Nation, Jane King and other media to discuss economic and financial industry topics.

Norm’s first book, Going Public, about his experiences at the SEC is available at Amazon, www.Barnesandnoble.com and other online sellers. For more information on Norm’s books and speaking engagements, visit www.normchamp.com.

Prior to GreyLion, Ms. Colombo was Chief Financial Officer & Managing Director of CCMP Capital Advisors. Previously, she held a variety of responsibilities at JPMorgan Partners, including investor reporting, investment structuring, portfolio management, financial control and valuation. Ms. Colombo began her career with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP where she worked in Consumer Markets & Real Estate Business Assurance practices. Ms. Colombo received a B.B.A. from Hofstra University in Accounting. Ms. Colombo is a co-founder and board member of Parents Against Vaping e-cigarettes, a not-for profit advocacy and education organization powered by parent volunteers to fight the youth vaping epidemic. She also serves on the Board of Directors of 1800-FLOWERS.COM.

GreyLion (formerly PWP Growth Equity) focuses on investing in high-growth businesses in the lower middle market. We seek to partner with existing owners and management teams across the industrial growth, services, technology, healthcare and consumer sectors to deliver capital in minority and control structures. GreyLion invests $25-$125 million of capital per investment, primarily within the United States. We currently manage private equity funds with aggregate commitments of over $1.7 billion.

Mark Feirman is a Partner and CFO of Cross Rapids. Prior to joining Cross Rapids in November 2020, Mr. Feirman was at KKR from 2008 to 2020, most recently as a Director. From 2017 to 2020, he led a newly formed Private Markets Operations team, focused on cross-functional efficiencies, specifically streamlining the investment closing process for deal teams, LP onboarding and client communications, as well as data and performance analysis with regards to the firm and portfolio companies. From 2008 to 2016, Mr. Feirman held roles of increasing responsibility as controller for the firm’s management company, responsible for all accounting and financial reporting for the Private Markets business, which included private equity, real assets, and other related strategies. Prior to joining KKR, Mr. Feirman worked at AEA Advisors, Overseas Shipholding Group, and VNU Expositions. Mr. Feirman began his career as an auditor at Ernst & Young LLP. Mr. Feirman, who holds his CPA license in the state of New York, graduated from Binghamton University, where he earned a B.S. in Accounting.

Cross Rapids Capital LP is an operations-centric value investment management firm, focused on control private equity investments in industrial and services companies. Cross Rapids seeks to acquire control of lower middle market industrial and services companies that are often overlooked and undervalued by other investors in order to transform and accelerate them and, in doing so, unlock value for our investors. The Founding Partners established the Firm in 2020 and have operated together as Cross Rapids for over three years.

Jon is Rubicon’s chief financial officer and chief compliance officer. He orchestrates key behind-the-scenes operations, overseeing Rubicon’s finance and back office activities.

Before joining Rubicon, Jon was a tax partner in PwC’s asset and wealth management practice. During his 24 years at PwC, he served some of the largest and most complex private equity and venture capital firms in the world. He has become a trusted authority on structuring funds, investments and everything related to pooled investment vehicles and their owners.

Jon holds a master of science in Accounting-Taxation from the University of Colorado Boulder and a bachelor of arts in mathematics from Binghamton University. He is a CPA in Colorado and California.

Fang Fang joined Turnspire Capital in 2023 as Chief Financial Officer. Fang Fang has over 14 years of experience in the alternative investments space within private equity, real estate, hedge funds and fund of funds. Her experience spans across finance, accounting, treasury, compliance, investor relations, tax and audit.

Before joining Turnspire Capital, Fang Fang was a Vice President at ICONIQ Capital, where she managed open ended and closed ended real estate funds, SPV funds and General Partner entities in the Merchant Bank Finance department. Prior to ICONIQ, Fang Fang was a Fund Controller at Madison International Realty, where she oversaw the finance and accounting functions of various real estate private equity funds. Prior to that, she was a Fund Accountant at Anchorage Capital and supported private equity funds and hedge funds. She started her career at PricewaterhouseCoopers as an auditor in the Alternative Investments group. Fang Fang is also a Certified Public Accountant in the State of New York.

Fang Fang graduated from Binghamton University School of Management with a BS in accounting.

Jeffrey Gilbert is the Chief Operating Officer and Chief Legal Officer of Carnelian Energy Capital Management, L.P., where he leads internal operations, including compliance, human resources, vendor selection, community relations and other strategic firm and legal matters, in addition to serving as a resource to Carnelian’s portfolio companies. Prior to joining Carnelian, Mr. Gilbert was an attorney in the Houston office of Bracewell LLP. Mr. Gilbert grew up in Houston, Texas, and received a Bachelor’s of Journalism with highest honors from The University of Texas at Austin and a J.D. with honors from The University of Texas School of Law.

Carnelian Energy Capital is a North American-focused investment firm with an established track record of value creation across the energy sector. With approximately $4 billion of cumulative capital commitments, Carnelian is dedicated to bringing its strategic expertise and nimble approach to partnerships with leading businesses and best-in-class management teams.

Josh is the CFO at Freestyle and leads the firm’s financial operations. His early career started at Anchin, a NYC based accounting firm in the alternative investment division specializing in audit, tax and fund administration then moving on to Schwartz & Co. as a senior manager, working in the financial service and outsource CFO division. Most recently he was at Bedrock Capital where he held the position of CFO, in which his responsibilities included oversight of portfolio company reporting and valuation, limited partner reporting and communications, compliance and all fund accounting/operations. Prior to joining Bedrock Capital, he was the CFO and CCO at Lerer Hippeau, a New York-based venture capital firm. Josh graduated from the University of Buffalo with a BA in Business Administration, where he studied Accounting.

Firm Profile:

Freestyle is an early-stage venture capital firm with over $565.0M AUM and investments in over 130 technology companies including Airtable, Intercom, Patreon, and BetterUp. General Partners David Samuel and Jenny Lefcourt are serial entrepreneurs and business operators with more than 25 years of technology experience. Freestyle was founded in 2009, being one of the first firms to specialize exclusively on seed-stage companies, be composed of founders turned VCs, and proactively work to improve diversity in the industry. To learn more about us, please visit http://freestyle.vc

Ms. Gomer joined Maverick Ventures as Chief Operating Officer in 2022. Prior to Maverick, she was an attorney at Sidley Austin LLP specializing in private investments and M&A for fund sponsors and their portfolio companies. Spending nearly ten years in corporate practice, Ms. Gomer led a broad range of private financing transactions, growth equity investments, leveraged buyouts, carve-outs, joint ventures and leveraged recapitalizations. Ms. Gomer holds a J.D. from Harvard Law School and a B.A. from Rice University (summa cum laude).

Maverick Ventures is the venture arm of multi-billion dollar investment firm Maverick Capital. Combining the resources of a global firm with the benefits of an agile, focused team, Maverick Ventures supports entrepreneurs from seed through maturity. With over 30 years of early-stage investment experience, the Maverick Ventures team has funded more than 100 companies in the healthcare, software and deep technology sectors. Learn more about San Francisco-based Maverick Ventures at www.maverickventures.com.

Monica is chief financial officer of Antares Capital and is a member of the Antares Capital Executive Committee. She is responsible for the Finance, Operations and IT functions.

Prior to joining Antares in 2022, Monica was managing director and chief financial officer at Madison Capital Funding LLC, a position that she held since 2004. Previously, she was executive director, head of Global Finance at UBS Global Asset Management. Monica began her career with the audit firm of PricewaterhouseCoopers.

A Certified Public Accountant, Monica earned a BS in Accounting/Computer Information Systems from Murray State University and an MBA from Northwestern University Kellogg Graduate School of Management.

Founded in 1996, Antares is an experienced and cycle-tested alternative asset manager and a leading provider of financing for PE-backed borrowers. With one of the most seasoned teams in the industry, Antares is focused on delivering attractive risk-adjusted returns for investors and creating long term-value for stakeholders. The firm manages $64B+ of capital under management and administration as of June 30, 2023, and maintains offices in Atlanta, Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, Toronto and London. Visit Antares at www.antares.com or follow the company on LinkedIn at http://www.linkedin.com/company/antares-capital-lp. Antares Capital is a subsidiary of Antares Holdings LP, (collectively, “Antares”). Antares Capital London Limited is an appointed representative of Langham Hall Fund Management LLP, an entity which is authorized and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority of the UK.

Steve is a Senior Managing Director with Stonepeak and is the firm’s Chief Financial Officer. Prior to Stonepeak, Steve held senior finance and accounting roles with Staple Street Capital, Apollo and Deloitte. A Connecticut native, Steve received a Bachelor of Science in Accounting from the University of Connecticut and a Master of Business Administration from Yale University and is a Certified Public Accountant, Chartered Global Management Accountant, CFA Charterholder and holds FINRA Series 7 and 27 securities licenses.

Stonepeak is a leading alternative investment firm specializing in infrastructure and real assets with approximately $61.1 billion of assets under management. Through its investment in defensive, hard-asset businesses globally, Stonepeak aims to create value for its investors and portfolio companies, with a focus on downside protection and strong risk-adjusted returns. Stonepeak, as sponsor of private equity and credit investment vehicles, provides capital, operational support, and committed partnership to grow investments in its target sectors, which include communications, energy and energy transition, transport and logistics, and real estate. Stonepeak is headquartered in New York with offices in Hong Kong, Houston, London, Singapore, and Sydney. For more information, please visit www.stonepeak.com.

Ms. O’Connor is the Chief Financial Officer for Cerberus with oversight of the Firm’s global financial infrastructure. Prior to joining Cerberus in 2023, Ms. O’Connor was most recently the Chief Financial Officer of BlackRock’s Alternative Investment Funds. An accomplished finance leader, Ms. O’Connor has also served throughout her career in various senior positions at Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Sculptor Capital Management.

Ms. O’Connor previously served as the International Advisor to the Irish Financial Services Strategic Advisory Group and the Irish Financial Services Industry Advisory committee. She is currently the Co-Chair of the NICSA Diversity Project North America for the Asset Management industry. She has served on the Board of Directors for several organizations, including the Women’s Bond Club, Concern USA, and the Irish Repertory Theater.

Ms. O’Connor graduated from Munster Technological University and is a Chartered Management Accountant with CIMA and GCMA.

Tara is a founding partner of Paceline and serves as the Chief Financial Officer. Prior to forming Paceline, Tara was most recently a Managing Director with Hudson Advisors, LLC (“Hudson”), an asset management affiliate of Lone Star Funds, where she oversaw the regional finance function and operations for the North American investments of Lone Star. In this role, Tara served as a member of Lone Star’s Liquidity Risk Committee. Tara previously served as a Finance Director with Hudson from July 2011 to June 2014 and a Vice President at Hudson from November 2008 to December 2010, with a focus on the region’s asset valuation, investor reporting, and cash management. Tara’s tenure at Hudson ended in March 2017.

Prior to joining Hudson, from August 2003 to June 2008, Tara served in a variety of corporate finance roles at Unilever, a global consumer products company. Previously, Tara was an Analyst with Lucent Technologies focused on new venture product management and business development. Tara received a Bachelor of Science from Cornell University and holds a Master of Business Administration from the MIT Sloan School of Management.

Tracy is a Partner with Yellow Wood Partners and is responsible for all the financial, operational, and compliance aspects of the firm. Tracy joined Yellow Wood Partners in August 2016 as Chief Financial Officer and was promoted to Partner in 2020. She has over 20 years of experience managing financial operations for private equity, hedge fund, and financial services firms. Tracy holds a BS in Business Administration with a major in Accounting from Bucknell University and an MS in Taxation from Bentley University. She is a certified public accountant.

Yellow Wood Partners is a Boston-based private investment firm that invests exclusively in the consumer industry in the middle market. The firm seeks to acquire branded consumer products that sell into a variety of consumer channels, including mass, drug, food, specialty, value, club and e-commerce. Yellow Wood’s investment and operating strategy is based on utilizing the firm’s Consumer Operating DNA strategy which brings functional operating resources to maximize brand performance by driving organic growth and increasing operating efficiencies in a limited number of platform entities which also incorporate highly accretive add-on acquisitions to drive growth and increased equity value. For more information, please visit www.yellowwoodpartners.com.

Matt Norris is a Senior Partner with The Edgewater Funds and serves as Chief Financial Officer and Chief Compliance Officer. Matt leads the finance team and oversees all aspects of financial reporting, tax, fund administration, regulatory compliance, investor relations, administrative and human resource functions for the firm.

Prior to joining Edgewater in 2008, Matt worked at the public accounting firm of Bansley & Kiener, LLP. Matt received his Bachelor of Science degree in accountancy from Miami University of Ohio and is a Certified Public Accountant in the State of Illinois (inactive).

Matt serves on the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees of Holy Trinity High School in Chicago.

Berat joined Heartwood Partners in August 2018 as a Fund Controller and was later promoted to Controller and Tax Manager.

Prior to joining Heartwood Partners, Berat was a Senior Fund Accountant with Atlas Holdings LLC, a $3.0 billion special situations & distressed buyout private equity firm based in Greenwich, CT. Prior to Atlas, he was a Senior Associate at KPMG in the alternative investments tax practice, providing tax consulting and compliance services to private equity, real estate, and manufacturing clients.

Education:

Bachelor of Arts in Accounting and Finance from Western Connecticut State University

Tracing its roots back to 1982, Heartwood Partners intertwines deep strategic and financial expertise to be a true partner to founders and owners seeking to enhance their businesses’ performance.

Mike is a Chief Financial Officer and Partner with over 20 years of experience in financial services, including 14 years of experience in venture capital. He has a deep understanding of the industry and is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the company's finance, compliance, back office, legal, and operations functions. His expertise is instrumental in building solid foundations for Primary’s continuous growth. Mike began his career in Poland, in commercial banking, and after moving to the United States in 2000, transitioned to financial services focused on hedge fund operations, and then to venture capital, where he has spent the majority of his career. Mike gets the biggest satisfaction from sharing his knowledge and brainstorming ideas, and especially from mentoring younger colleagues and letting them achieve their full potential.

Primary is New York’s leading early stage firm, with a billion in assets under management and 50 full time employees. The team commits unreasonable resources to create unfair advantages for the world’s top founders. Primary’s Impact team outnumbers investors 2:1, and is filled with seasoned executives working alongside founders to supercharge growth and secure quality hires, early customers, and downstream investors. This team embeds with companies for 2,500 hours of high-intensity fractional leadership work, conducts 3,000 candidate interviews, maintains a pool of 5,000+ active job seekers, and hosts 250 events large and small for the NYC tech community each year. Cofounders Brad Svrluga and Ben Sun have won recognition from Forbes' Midas List and Insider's Seed 100.

Jason is a Managing Director and the Chief Financial Officer for Audax Private Equity, based in Boston. In this capacity, he is responsible for financial reporting, valuation and administration of Audax Group’s private equity funds and the financial operations of the private equity business. Prior to joining Audax in 2017, Jason was a Vice President, Finance, at General Atlantic and previously served as a Controller at Bessemer Venture Partners. He began his career at PricewaterhouseCoopers L.L.P., where he served as a senior associate performing audit and business advisory services for private equity, venture capital and fortune 500 clients.

Jason received a B.S. from Quinnipiac University and was a registered Certified Public Accountant in the State of Connecticut (inactive).

Audax Group is a leading alternative investment manager with offices in Boston, New York, and San Francisco. Since its founding in 1999, the firm has raised over $30 billion in capital across its Private Equity and Private Debt businesses. Audax Private Equity has invested over $8 billion in more than 150 platforms and over 1,100 add-on companies, and is currently investing out of its $3.5 billion, sixth private equity fund. Through its disciplined Buy & Build approach, Audax seeks to help platform companies execute add-on acquisitions that fuel revenue growth, optimize operations, and significantly increase equity value. With more than 135 investment professionals, Audax Private Equity is a leading capital partner for North American middle market companies. For more information, visit the Audax Private Equity website https://www.audaxprivateequity.com/.

Kelly joined Centre Partners in 2020 and is responsible for oversight of all accounting, reporting and compliance functions, as well as HR, IT and other administrative functions. Prior thereto, she was the Management Company Controller at American Securities LLC and the Chief Financial Officer of The Arlon Group, both private equity firms. Before that, Kelly spent 13 years at State Street Bank and Trust, where she held a variety of roles in their private equity fund administration business. She started her career at PwC. Kelly received a B.S. in Accounting from the University of Scranton, an M.B.A. from Seton Hall University and is a Certified Public Accountant (inactive status).

Aileen is responsible for overseeing Ethos’ accounting, finance and operations activities. Prior to joining Ethos, Aileen was a Senior Vice President of Finance for Audax Group. During her 21-year tenure, she oversaw the growth of the finance support functions for the private equity and private debt funds. She also previously worked as a Finance Associate at Summit Partners and a Senior Accountant at Liberty Energy Corporation.

Ethos Capital is a values-driven investment firm that collaborates with its portfolio companies, providing them with resources and expertise in order to accelerate their growth. We invest in seasoned information service companies, with proven business models, that are ready for accelerated growth and enhanced performance through the application of new technologies and sector-focused operating experience.

Mr. Millin joined Performance Equity as a Manager of Finance in June 2005, and served as Controller for the management company since 2008. In March 2015, he was named Director of Fund Administration. In January 2019 Mr. Millin was named Senior Vice President of Finance and in 2020, he was named Chief Financial Officer.

Prior to joining Performance Equity in 2005, he held positions in the audit divisions of Bank of America and Deloitte & Touche LLP. Earlier in his career, Mr. Millin held positions in the operations groups of The NASDAQ Stock Market and Brown Brothers Harriman.

He received a Bachelor of Science with a dual major in Finance and Law & Public Policy from Syracuse University, an MBA with a major in Finance from Fordham University, and a Certificate in Accounting from Pace University. Mr. Millin is a Certified Public Accountant licensed in the State of Connecticut.

Peter Tang is the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and a Managing Director at Butterfly. In this role, Mr. Tang oversees all aspects of the firm's financial activities and leads the firm’s strategic and growth initiatives. Prior to his appointment as CFO, he was one of the first members of the Investment Team and has played a key role in several of Butterfly’s investments, including Bolthouse Farms, Pacifico Aquaculture and Pete and Gerry's. He currently serves on the board of directors of Pacifico Aquaculture and the Butterfly Equity Foundation.

Prior to joining Butterfly, Mr. Tang worked at KKR on the Consumer Retail Private Equity team where he was an investment team member on several transactions including Academy Sports + Outdoors and Channel Control Merchants. Previously, Mr. Tang was with Moelis & Company where he was involved in a variety of mergers, acquisitions and restructuring transactions, including several in the food industry. Mr. Tang graduated from the Richard Ivey School of Business of the University of Western Ontario with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Honors Business Administration.

Butterfly Equity is a Los Angeles, California-based private equity firm specializing in the food sector, spanning the entire food value chain from “seed to fork” via four key segments: upstream & processing, industry enablers, multi-site and branded goods. Butterfly manages over $4 billion of assets to date and aims to generate attractive investment returns through deep industry specialization, a disciplined and data-driven investment process and a hands-on approach to portfolio transformation. For additional information about Butterfly, please visit its website at www.bfly.com.
